section.name: Running the HST example site
section.p: The show the possiblities of the HST in practice, a complete JSP site has been made available for download. It is in fact the currently running onehippo.com website. To run it, you also need a combined CMS 7 / Repository 2 with initial content in it.

subsection.name: Download and run example Repository 2 / CMS 7.
subsection.p: Download the onehippo.com ECM as a war.
Deploy the war in your favorite web server, like Tomcat or JBoss. See here for more information on deploying the ECM.

subsection.name: Download and run the HST example site.
subsection.p: Download the onehippo.com site as a war.
Deploy the war in your favorite web server. The current distribution assumes that the following components are provided:

ul.li: Java Transaction API (JTA), normally provided by the web server. If your web server lacks it, like Tomcat does, you may want to install for instance Geronimo's geronimo-spec-jta-1.0.1B-rc2.jar. It may be obtained under through the Apache Geronimo project as with Maven 2 groupID geronimo-spec and artifactId geronimo-spec-jta.

Standard core and formatting taglibs: the example site uses two standard taglibs, core (c:) and formatting (fmt:). These taglibs should be provided by the container and may be obtained through the Apache Jakarta project. The version should be 1.1.2 or higher.

subsection.p: If you are running the site in Tomcat, the above components can be installed in Tomcat's shared/lib directory.
